data.title: Where to Stream New Documentary ‘In the Arena: Serena Williams’ Online
data.meta_description: After its premiere at Tribeca Film Festival, 'In the Arena: Serena Williams' is now streaming.
data.text:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, The Hollywood Reporter may receive an affiliate commission.

After the first two episodes made its world premiere at the Tribeca Film Festival earlier this year (along with the tennis documentary Federer: Twelve Final Days), In the Arena: Serena Williams is finally available to stream at home.

Premiering on Wednesday, July 10 on ESPN+, In the Arena: Serena Williams is a new TV docuseries about the career of tennis star Williams, who continues to be one of the most beloved figures in the sport even after her retirement.

At a Glance: How to Watch In the Arena: Serena Williams Online

In the Arena: Serena Williams follows the former tennis star’s career in her own words. Williams talks about her early days, her important milestones, her Grand Slam wins and appearances — including winning Wimbledon multiple times — as well as her life off the court.

Keep reading for more about In the Arena: Serena Williams’ premiere date and start time, episode schedule, how to watch the TV show with and without cable and more.

How to Watch In the Arena: Serena Williams: Date and Time, Episode Release Schedule

Spanning eight episodes, In the Arena: Serena Williams premieres with the first installment on Wednesday, July 10, at 9 p.m. PT/12 a.m. ET on ESPN+. The following episodes drop at the same time every Wednesday until the season finale on Aug. 28.

You’ll need a ESPN+ subscription to watch In the Arena: Serena Williams. The streaming service is $10.99 per month ($109.99 per year) and it’s where you’ll find live sports from pro sports leagues like UFC, NHL, F1, NFL and others. You’ll also find on-demand programming like The Pat McAfee Show, 30 For 30, McEnroe’s Places, Man in the Arena: Tom Brady, Southern Hoops: A History of SEC Basketball, Deion’s Double Play and others.

Where to Watch In the Arena: Serena Williams on TV

In the Arena: Serena Williams isn’t available to watch on any network TV channel right now. The only way to watch is with a subscription to ESPN+.

Watch In the Arena: Serena Williams on ESPN+: Best Streaming Deals

Want to find a great deal to get ESPN+? One of the best deals to stream In the Arena: Serena Williams is with the Disney Trio bundle, which includes ESPN+, Hulu and Disney+ for just $14.99 per month — nearly 45 percent off paying for each service separately. You can even go somewhat commercial-free with Disney Trio Premium, which has ESPN+ with ads and Hulu and Disney+ without ads for $24.99 per month.

How to Watch In the Arena: Serena Williams Online Free

For cord-cutters, a subscription to Hulu + Live TV includes live cable streaming, plus access to ESPN+, Disney+ and Hulu for $76.99 per month (with ads). Right now, the streamer is offer a rare 3-day free trial that you can use to watch the Serena Williams documentary online for free. Continue on from $76.99 a month or cancel before your free trial is up to avoid being charged. Pther bundles with and without ads are $81.99 to $89.99 monthly.
